dict.string: First, "4" and "3" are compared. "4" is greater than "3".
Therefore, "4" is swapped with "3". Now, the number on the left is smaller than the number on the right.
Now, we continue "bubbling" to the right and compare "4" with "2". 
"4" is greater than "2", so these numbers get swapped.
This time "4" is smaller than "7", so no swap is needed.
Continue bubbling to the right and compare "7" and "0".
Obviously, these numbers need to be swapped.
"7" is compared to "8". We do not need to swap these two numbers.
Now, we have reach the right end of the list. In one round of operations, the greatest number in the list has moved to the right end and is in a correct position.
Next step, we come back to the front of the list and repeat the "bubbling" operation. This time, "3" is compared to "2".
Swap "3" with "2".
"3" and "4" are now compared to each other. They are in the right order so no swap is needed.
Compare "4" and "0".
Swap "4" and "0".
Compare "4" and "7". No swap is needed. Now, "7" is in correct position.
We comeback to the front of the list and compare "2" and "3". No swap is needed.
Compare "3" and "0".
Swap "3" and "0".
Compare "3" and "4". No swap is needed. Now, "4" is in correct position.
Back to the front of the list and compare "2" and "0".
Swap "2" and "0".
Compare "2" and "3". No swap is needed. Now, "3" is in correct position.
Compare "0" and "2". No swap is needed. Now, "0" and "2" are in correct positions.
